message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses the memory and information processing capabilities of recurrent neural networks, which are commonly studied in the field of neural networks and machine learning (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the performance of the system on signal processing tasks in a supervised learning setup, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the function-structure relation in RNNs, which is a topic of interest in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of short-term memory in building alternative computer architectures, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the expected error and worst-case error bound, which is a topic of interest in information theory (cs.IT).
